author: andschwa
body: Blocking bug for item #128       Should be able to call function without error 143ms    Expected  the expression not to throw an exception. Message was  The term 'Invoke WebRequest' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program. Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.         from  opt monad src pester tests Test Invoke WebRequest.Tests.ps1 3 char 10                   Invoke WebRequest www.google.com    Should Not Throw                                        at line  3 in  opt monad src pester tests Test Invoke WebRequest.Tests.ps1    3           Invoke WebRequest www.google.com    Should Not Throw  Does not see cmdlet changes.  Cmdlet relies on the System.Net, mshtml, Microsoft.Win32, and system.X509Certificates as well as a number of other libraries that may be encumbering the implementation of the Web calls  Like invoke webrequest   VSO create date - 8/3/2015 13:40:00

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: This issue does not appear cohesive. It's complaining about #85, and #87. Closing because these are better tracked independently.

title: [BLOCKED by CoreCLR] WebCmdlets .Net, x509, and win32
